page.title: 16SUTTON BONINGTON POST OFFICE
page.content: The{Post Office}is in the S. part of the village,{Mr Beers}is the{Post - {master.}It gives a number of services including{stamps, postal orders, {National Savings, banking, Premium {Bonds, DHSS work, family allowances, {unemployment benefits, dog and TV {licences.}The{mail}arrives at 06.40 for sorting. 1000-1500{letters}and {parcels}are sent out daily. Decisions at{Head Office}are worrying{Mr Beers about his{office}closing down. Old people would suffer most because they would have to get their{pensions}in {Loughborough.}It is a social event for them. Sometimes{Post Offices}run out of money, most of it is supplied from{Leicester}and some is obtained over the counter. Thousands of pounds are handled each week. Small{offices are always at risk of robbery as larger{offices}are better protected.
